ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Acoustic Shock Disorder / Tonic Tensor Tympani Syndrome (TTTS)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of acoustic incident (yelling in headset) followed immediately by tinnitus, hyperacusis, otalgia, and spasms; TMJ ruled out.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Audiometry reveals mild bilateral symmetrical sensorineural hearing loss.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing thresholds given reports of hearing difficulty and tinnitus.
To assess speech recognition abilities and tolerance levels.
To evaluate middle ear function and rule out conductive pathology.
To quantify sound tolerance given complaints of hyperacusis.
To characterize tinnitus pitch, loudness, and impact (TFI).

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient demonstrates mild bilateral symmetrical sensorineural hearing loss with normal middle ear function. The primary audiologic findings are significant hyperacusis, evidenced by reduced Loudness Discomfort Levels (70-80 dB HL), and bothersome tinnitus matched to 4000 Hz. Speech recognition is excellent but testing required reduced presentation levels due to sound sensitivity.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Mild bilateral symmetrical SNHL, flat configuration (approx 25-35 dB HL).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: WRS 90% (Right) and 86% (Left) at MCL (65 dB HL); standard levels were too uncomfortable.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal ear canal volume, static admittance, and middle ear pressure (Type A) bilaterally.

tests.name: Loudness Discomfort Levels (LDLs)
tests.result_summary: Reduced sound tolerance; LDLs 70-80 dB HL for pure tones and noise.

tests.name: Tinnitus Assessment
tests.result_summary: Pitch match 4000 Hz; Loudness match 56 dB HL (R) / 60 dB HL (L); TFI score 60; MML not obtained due to discomfort.

proposed_items: Bilateral RIC hearing aids (Widex Clear Fusion 440s) with open domes
Real Ear Measures (REM) to verify gain targets (initially set below target for acclimatization)
Real Ear Saturation Response (RESR90) to ensure output does not exceed LDLs
Sound therapy using Widex Zen tinnitus program (Zen Aqua)
Tinnitus Activities Treatment (TAT) using pictorial examples and analogies
Sound enrichment and desensitization exercises (listening to bothersome sounds at soft levels)
Work accommodations (separate room, noise-cancelling headphones, cushioned door, rubber caps on chairs)
counseling_actions: Informational counseling on the auditory system, tinnitus, and hyperacusis mechanisms
Explanation of the relationship between auditory, emotional, and fear centers
Advice against overprotection (earplugs) to avoid increasing central gain
Reassurance that loud sounds are annoying but unlikely to damage hearing
Instruction on gradual desensitization and sound enrichment

escalation.rationale_short: Ongoing management of tinnitus and hyperacusis via hearing aids, sound therapy, and counseling.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor progress, increase hearing aid acclimatization levels, review sound diary, and adjust therapy.

expected_outcome: Tinnitus Loudness Match: Measured at 46 dB HL (right) and 50 dB HL (left), a reduction of 10 dB in each ear.
Tinnitus Functional Index (TFI): Score reduced to 30 (a reduction of 30 points), indicating meaningful clinical improvement.
Loudness Discomfort Levels (LDLs): Increased by 6 to 10 dB across frequencies (Table 48.2), indicating improved sound tolerance.
Subjective report: Significant improvement in annoyance from tinnitus and hyperacusis; able to tolerate moderately loud sounds and returned to work with accommodations.
